intro: Pentagonia australis, commonly known as the Australian pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals arranged in a star-like pattern. Pentagonia australis is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions.
